title: Ranked in pre season
body: Is there any actual point in playing ranked during pre-season? What does it do to play ranked over norms until the season starts up again?

replies.body: Your rank in the pre-season effects next season.
Yea ok, how? Coz you still have to go through your provisionals and such

basically, your rank in the next season is determined by how well you do in placements, as well as your previous MMR. as you play ranked in pre-season, your MMR will go up/down, which will in turn affect your rank in the next season. (so using Alfawarrior's example, gold 5 MMR and an ok placement will get you in silver 2, but a plat 5 mmr and an ok placement will get you to gold 2)

> [{quoted}](name=Laramis,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=wOJIax6E,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-11-11T05:33:16.494+0000)
>
> Yea ok, how? Coz you still have to go through your provisionals and such

say you end the season at gold 5, and don't play ranked. next season when you do placements, you'll be placed at lets say silver 2.
but if you kept playing ranked and made it to plat 5, you'd be placed in gold 2 instead.
see how it works?

Problem is I think is that for mid diamond and high diamond/master/challenger it doesn't matter because the highest rank you can get is Plat 1, it kind of gets to a point where you can go like 5-5 which isn't hard or even 0-10 if you're high enough and still place in Plat 1, It also isn't hard for people of these ranks to climb from lets say Gold to diamond 5 so I kind of think it makes preseason games irrelevant for high elo as it doesn't matter what rank they officially finish the season as because they will get to the rank they were before in a low amount of games. I think that preseason is only so long is so that people can figure out how to play the game after all the new changes that is why what I think would be better is to shorten pre season to maybe end of November so people can figure out how to play the game with all these new changes without having this prolonged period where the games don't really matter

The way that ranked resets at the beginning of the season isn't a hard reset to put everyone at the same value - everyone is reset to a level that is relative to their rating at the start of the season. (This avoids the problem of having really strong players playing weaker players early in the season) This means that the games in the preseason can have an effect on where you start after placements next season.
